tc.c File Reference

Detailed Description

TC driver for AVR32 UC3.

AVR32 Timer/Counter driver module.

  • Compiler: IAR EWAVR32 and GNU GCC for AVR32
  • Supported devices: All AVR32 devices with a TC module can be used.
  • AppNote:

Author:
Atmel Corporation: http://www.atmel.com
Support and FAQ: http://support.atmel.no/

Definition in file tc.c.

#include <avr32/io.h>
#include "compiler.h"
#include "tc.h"

Go to the source code of this file.

int tc_configure_interrupts ( volatile avr32_tc_t *  tc,
unsigned int  channel,
const tc_interrupt_t *  bitfield 
)

Enables various timer/counter interrupts.

Parameters:
tc Pointer to the TC instance to access.
channel The TC instance channel to access.
bitfield The interrupt enable configuration.
Return values:
0 Success.
TC_INVALID_ARGUMENT Invalid argument(s).

Definition at line 60 of file tc.c.

References tc_interrupt_t::covfs, tc_interrupt_t::cpas, tc_interrupt_t::cpbs, tc_interrupt_t::cpcs, tc_interrupt_t::etrgs, tc_interrupt_t::ldras, tc_interrupt_t::ldrbs, tc_interrupt_t::lovrs, TC_INVALID_ARGUMENT, and TC_NUMBER_OF_CHANNELS.

00061 {
00062   // Check for valid input.
00063   if (channel >= TC_NUMBER_OF_CHANNELS)
00064     return TC_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
00065 
00066   // Enable the appropriate interrupts.
00067   tc->channel[channel].ier = bitfield->etrgs << AVR32_TC_ETRGS_OFFSET |
00068                              bitfield->ldrbs << AVR32_TC_LDRBS_OFFSET |
00069                              bitfield->ldras << AVR32_TC_LDRAS_OFFSET |
00070                              bitfield->cpcs << AVR32_TC_CPCS_OFFSET |
00071                              bitfield->cpbs << AVR32_TC_CPBS_OFFSET |
00072                              bitfield->cpas << AVR32_TC_CPAS_OFFSET |
00073                              bitfield->lovrs << AVR32_TC_LOVRS_OFFSET |
00074                              bitfield->covfs << AVR32_TC_COVFS_OFFSET;
00075 
00076   // Disable the appropriate interrupts.
00077   tc->channel[channel].idr = (~bitfield->etrgs & 1) << AVR32_TC_ETRGS_OFFSET |
00078                              (~bitfield->ldrbs & 1) << AVR32_TC_LDRBS_OFFSET |
00079                              (~bitfield->ldras & 1) << AVR32_TC_LDRAS_OFFSET |
00080                              (~bitfield->cpcs & 1) << AVR32_TC_CPCS_OFFSET |
00081                              (~bitfield->cpbs & 1) << AVR32_TC_CPBS_OFFSET |
00082                              (~bitfield->cpas & 1) << AVR32_TC_CPAS_OFFSET |
00083                              (~bitfield->lovrs & 1) << AVR32_TC_LOVRS_OFFSET |
00084                              (~bitfield->covfs & 1) << AVR32_TC_COVFS_OFFSET;
00085 
00086   return 0;
00087 }

int tc_select_external_clock ( volatile avr32_tc_t *  tc,
unsigned int  channel,
unsigned int  ext_clk_sig_src 
)

Selects which external clock to use and how to configure it.

Parameters:
tc Pointer to the TC instance to access.
channel The TC instance channel to access.
ext_clk_sig_src External clock signal selection:
  • TC_CH0_EXT_CLK0_SRC_TCLK0;
  • TC_CH0_EXT_CLK0_SRC_NO_CLK;
  • TC_CH0_EXT_CLK0_SRC_TIOA1;
  • TC_CH0_EXT_CLK0_SRC_TIOA2;
  • TC_CH1_EXT_CLK1_SRC_TCLK1;
  • TC_CH1_EXT_CLK1_SRC_NO_CLK;
  • TC_CH1_EXT_CLK1_SRC_TIOA0;
  • TC_CH1_EXT_CLK1_SRC_TIOA2;
  • TC_CH2_EXT_CLK2_SRC_TCLK2;
  • TC_CH2_EXT_CLK2_SRC_NO_CLK;
  • TC_CH2_EXT_CLK2_SRC_TIOA0;
  • TC_CH2_EXT_CLK2_SRC_TIOA1.
Return values:
0 Success.
TC_INVALID_ARGUMENT Invalid argument(s).

00091 {
00092   // Check for valid input.
00093   if (channel >= TC_NUMBER_OF_CHANNELS || ext_clk_sig_src >= 1 << AVR32_TC_BMR_TC0XC0S_SIZE)
00094     return TC_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
00095 
00096   // Clear bit-field and set the correct behavior.
00097   tc->bmr = (tc->bmr & ~(AVR32_TC_BMR_TC0XC0S_MASK << (channel * AVR32_TC_BMR_TC0XC0S_SIZE))) |
00098             (ext_clk_sig_src << (channel * AVR32_TC_BMR_TC0XC0S_SIZE));
00099 
00100   return 0;
00101 }

unsigned int  channel 
)

tc Pointer to the TC instance to access.
channel The TC instance channel to access.
Return values:
0 Success.
TC_INVALID_ARGUMENT Invalid argument(s).

Definition at line 183 of file tc.c.

References TC_INVALID_ARGUMENT, and TC_NUMBER_OF_CHANNELS.

00184 {
00185   // Check for valid input.
00186   if (channel >= TC_NUMBER_OF_CHANNELS)
00187     return TC_INVALID_ARGUMENT;
00188 
00189   // Reset the selected timer/counter channel.
00190   tc->channel[channel].ccr = AVR32_TC_SWTRG_MASK;
00191 
00192   return 0;
